attributes.action: extend the Blue Badge scheme to children under the age of two and children with severe temporary disabilities as accepted four years ago
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We are two mums who both have children that have a condition called Hip Dysplasia.
My daughter Mia has just turned two and had her first operation in September. Jessica is eleven months and has recently had her operation. After the operation they are placed in a hip spica cast which goes from the chest down to the ankles,legs at right angles with a bar in between. These casts are extremely heavy and wide and render the children completely immobile.
We were amazed when we found out that our children weren't eligible for a Blue Badge.It is completely impossible to get them in or out of a car in a normal car parking space.
Our campaign is being supported by the National charity "Steps" and also have other disability organisations including Contact a Family who are partners in the Every Disabled Child Matters campaign.
We have been getting the same answers from the Department for Transport,that they are consulting, that there are reviews ongoing.
